history.text: Hello
'ello there
I just saw a super movie.
Yeah? What is it called
It's a 2010 film called The Social Network.
Oh.
It's based on a book
The one about Mark Zuckerberg?
Yes!  The book is called The Accidental Billionaires

Zuckerburg wasn't connected to the movie at all, except for the fact that
 it was all about him.

I wonder if it was really "accidental", as in pure "luck"? Does the movie include the lawsuit '
controversy'?
I see. So is The Social Network any different from the Facebook tone, i.e., narcissism involving Mark Zuckerberg himself?
Well, it starts out with him getting in trouble and put on probation for 6 month at Harvard.
Then the Winklevoss twins and Narendra invite hi to come work with them at their social network they started up.
Are you interested in the critic's ratings at all?
Yes, I think I am.
I'm trying to make sense of whether if the film is factual or fictionalized
Well, it got 96% out of 100 on Rotten Tomatoes, 95/100 Metacritic and CinemaScore B+
Oh, really? what about IMDB?
I would guess, depending on who you talk to, it is either extremely factual or a pack of lies.
I didn't get the IMDB score, but one critic called it the movie of the year.
Does the movie improve Mark Zuckerberg's popularity overall?

As to your question about authenticity, another critic said it takes liberties with its subject.  I would say no, it would not seem to improve his popularity, but as the old adage goes, there's no such thing as bad publicity.
That's true.
Well, as the film goes on, it starts having cutins to the depositions that the Winklevoss twins gave.
Ah, there's that.
I think I'm more inclined to watching it
It really does make Zuckerburg look bad.  It's definitely a must-see.
Who is acting as Mark Zuckerberg?
Jesse Eisenberg plays Zuckerberg.
Couple of bergs there, wouldn't you say?
oh, that goofball actor...
Yes, haha.
It has Justin Timberlake in it.
The twins are played by a single actor.
I'd like to see the film, because both bergs are goofs, excellent choice of casting
Oh, interesting, I didn't know
Yes, it was Armie Hammer playing the twins.  Wonder if that is his real name?
Anyway, he settles out of court with Severnin.
No idea. Probably not. Some actors chose names that best suited in the profession that they strive for
I won't tell you too much more, don't want to spoil it too much.

uid1response.feedback:
Although I probably won't have time to watch the movie, I think I am more inclined to watching it given the conversation I've had. 

I've had original intention of not watching the Social Network, but now, well.... that's an interesting change.

uid2response.feedback: There is an error on the document's last page in the top paragraph, where a portion of what looks like another movie is appended to the end of the paragraph.
